row.notes: The 8八 principles法 of the Yong永 character字. The 8 basic stroke types in calligraphy are all included within the character 永: Dash made using 'side' of brush tip(側), horizontal 'bridle'(勒), vertical 'crossbow' bolt(弩・努), 'jumping' hook(趯), 'horse whip' hook(策), 'brushing' curve(掠), 'pecking' slant(啄), 'cutting edge' sweep(磔)

row.english: Extending your life; Staving off the grim reaper

row.jpn: 命を延ばして災いを取り去ること。

row.jpn: 相手に応じて適切に指導すること。

row.notes: Going往 from ancient古 times arriving来 in the present今

row.kun: 衣(イ)を解(と)き、食(ショク)を推(お)す
row.notes: Han Xin (韓信) was planning to strike at Xiang Yu (項羽) King of Wu, so Xiang Yu sent a servant to convince Han Xin otherwise. However, Han Xin expressed his distaste for Xiang Yu and admiration for his current master, ruler of Han, saying the kind ruler "undid解 his garments衣 to clothe me and offered推 his meal食 for me to eat." In other words, Han Xin had been shown great mercy.
row.jpn: 人に慈悲を施すこと。

row.kun: 過(あやま)ちを改(あらた)め、自(みずか)ら新(あらた)にす
row.english: Righting your wrongs and improving yourself

row.jpn: 自分の過ちを改めて、気分を新たにすること。

row.kun: 巻(かん)を開(ひら)けば益(えき)有(あ)り
row.english: A book containing very useful knowledge

row.english: How to light a charcoal fire based on season

row.notes: Complete完全 and without無 flaw欠

row.english: To recognize the Way and put it into practice through learning
row.notes: One of the three ways of discovering the Way according to the Doctrine of the Mean. One is to be born with innate knowledge of the Way (生知安行). One is to learn学 of it, know知 it, recognize its benefit利 and practice行 it. The third is to realize the Way only after great suffering and effort (困知勉行).

After being captured by rebellion leader An Lushan (安禄山), Yan continued to pledge loyalty to his emperor and heap criticism on his captors despite having his tongue cut out.

row.notes: Gold金 and jewels玉 represent something very precious. 科 and 条 mean rule or law.

row.notes: Room堂 full満 of gold金 and jewels玉

row.notes: A golden金 castle城 surrounded by boiling湯 lake池

row.notes: 月下 comes from 月下老人 'the old man under the moon.' A man named Wei Gu (韋固) meets a strange old man who can predict someone's most suitable partner. 氷人 refers to a 'person beneath the ice' who (令孤策) speaks with in a dream.

row.notes: Saying言 is easy易, doing行 is hard難

row.notes: A person者 who speaks言 is one who does not不 know知

row.notes: Decrease減 in income収, decrease減 in profit益
row.jpn: 収入が減って利益が減ること。

row.notes: Strictly厳 correcting正 one's position to neutrality中立
row.jpn: 紛争の際、どちらにも味方しないで、固くかたよらない立場を守ること。

row.notes: 公明 is open and honest. 正大 is fair and well-mannered.

row.notes: Gaoyang (高陽) wine酒 student徒. Liu Bang (劉邦) was fighting the Qin秦 dynasty and advancing his rebel army through Gaoyang, now Baoding city of Hebei province. A man named Li Yiji (酈食其) requests an audience, but Liu Bang refuses. Li Yiji is dressed in Confucianist attire and Liu Bang hates Confucian scholars. Li Yiji says, "I'm not a student of Confucius, I'm a Gaoyang student of wine!" Liu Bang was intrigued and met with Li Yiji, who would go on to be his trusted advisor.
row.jpn: 酒飲みをいう

row.english: From long ago until now; Since olden times
row.notes: From ancient古 times going往 to the present今 coming来

row.kun: 牛(うし)と呼(よ)び、馬(うま)と呼(よ)ぶ
row.english: Like water off a duck's back

row.jpn: 相手の言うのにまかせて逆らわないこと。他人から誉められようとけなされようと取り合わず勝手にさせておくこと。

row.notes: Dust-blackened黒 winds風 and white白 rain雨
row.jpn: 暴風雨。

row.english: National interests and the people's welfare
row.notes: National国 interests利 and the people's民 welfare福
row.jpn: 国家の利益と民族の幸福。

row.notes: Olden古 times, now今, East東 and West西
row.jpn: いつでもどこでも。

row.notes: In olden古 time and now今, alone独 it has walked歩
row.jpn: 昔から今に至るまで、並ぶものがないほどすぐれていること。

row.english: ① The origin or history of something ② The reason or factor behind a result
row.notes: 故事 is an interesting historical story or anecdote. 来歴 is a series of historical events.

row.kun: 骨肉(コツニク)相(あい)食(は)む
row.notes: Bones骨 and meat肉 eating食 [each other>相
row.jpn: 肉親どうしが争うこと。

row.english: Achieving knowledge or success through intense study
row.notes: Endure great troubles困 to know知 the Way, and put in strenuous efforts勉 to enact行 it. One of the three ways of discovering the Way according to the Doctrine of the Mean. One is to be born with innate knowledge of the Way (生知安行). One is to learn学 of it, know知 it, recognize its benefit利 and practice行 it. The third is to realize the Way only after great suffering and effort (困知勉行).
row.jpn: 苦しんで学び努力して物事を実行すること。

row.notes: Originally meant focus on Buddhist teachings, now more broadly being (overly) devoted to something
row.jpn: 常に心をこめて物事に励むこと。また、物を大切に保持すること。

row.notes: From Confucian Analects: "At 50五十, I knew知 my destiny命."
row.jpn: 五十歳で天命を知ること。

row.notes: No断 method道 to express in words言語

row.jpn: たびたび。何度も何度も

row.notes: 裁断 is making a clear judgement of good or bad. 批評 is criticism. System for giving a critical opinion on cultural works. Popular in 17th-18th century Europe.
row.jpn: 裁判官が判決を下すように、文芸作品を一段高いある基準で判定する批評の方法。

row.english: Self-improvement by taking on the positive qualities of another

row.jpn: 人の長所をとり入れ、自分の短所を補うこと。

row.notes: People going往 right右 and going往 left左. Usu 右往左往
row.jpn: 多くの人がうろたえて右に行ったり左に行ったり混乱すること。

row.jpn: 史書を著作する史家に必要な三つの長所。

row.jpn: 文章の構想を練るのに適した三つの場所。

row.notes: Examine察 speech言 and observe観 expressions色

row.notes: Three三 days of cold寒, four四 days of warmth温; Refers to days alternating hot/cold as the season changes
row.jpn: 寒かったり暖かかったりすること。

row.notes: There is no無 peace安 (of mind) among the three三 realms界. These are the desire realm, the form realm and the formless realm--all the realms one passes through during life and rebirth. Essentially, hardship and suffering is inherent to all realms and all existence.
row.jpn: この世に生きることは、いろいろ苦労が多く少しも心が安まることがないこと。

row.notes: Standing tall高 as a mountain山 and exploits flowing long長 and endless like water水
row.jpn: 人の品性が高大で高潔なたとえ。

row.english: ① Scattered about, spread all over ② Small groups of people going down a road
row.notes: Groups of three三 and five五 scattered about
row.jpn: ばらばらと。ちらほらと。数人ずつかたまって道を行くさま。

row.reading: さんさんりょうりょう
row.english: ① Scattered about, spread all over ② Small groups of people going down a road
row.notes: Groups of three三 and pairs両 scattered about
row.jpn: ばらばらと。ちらほらと。数人ずつかたまって道を行くさま。

row.kun: 三(み)たび思(おも)いて後(のち)に行(おこな)う
row.english: Giving something a lot of thought before acting
row.notes: Act行 after後 thinking思 three三 times. Jiwen Zi (季文子) of Wu魯 was a very meticulous person who always thought three times before acting. When Confucius heard of this, he said, 'Two real good thinks is probably thought enough.'
row.jpn: 物事を行う場合に、よくよく考えたのちにはじめて実行に移すこと。

row.notes: The three三 types種 of divine神 objects器 given to Tenson Kōrin by Amaterasu: the mirror of wisdom, Yata no Kagami (八咫鏡); the jewel of benevolence, Yasakani no Magatama (八尺瓊勾玉); and the sword of valor, Ame no Murakumo no Tsurugi (天叢雲剣).
row.jpn: 皇位の標識とした三つの宝物。

row.reading: さんじゃくのしゅうすい

row.notes: Sometimes retreat is better than any of the 36三十六 military strategies計 of ancient China
row.jpn: 逃げるべきときには逃げるのがどんな策より一番安全の策である。

row.notes: 三寸 is three sun寸, a small unit of length. 不律 is a term for 'brush' said to come from nations of Shu蜀 and Wu呉.
row.jpn: 短い筆。

row.notes: Three三 sages聖, Confucianist Su Shi (蘇軾), Taoist Huang Tingjian (黄庭堅) and Buddhist Fo Yin (佛印) sipping吸 peach-blossom vinegar酸.
row.jpn: 儒教の蘇軾、道教の黄庭堅、仏教の僧仏印の三人が、桃花酸という酢をなめて三人ともそのすっぱさに顔をしかめたということ。三教の一致を風刺するものとしてよく画題とされる「三酸図」。

row.notes: Literally, three三 thousand千 world世界-systems in Buddhist cosmology. 1,000 sets of 1,000 worlds each containing 1,000 worlds.
row.jpn: この世のすべてをいう。

row.notes: Three三 supplications拝, five五 supplications拝
row.jpn: 何度も頭を下げて人に物を頼むこと。

row.english: ① Using sophistry ② A sophist
row.notes: Speaks言 on your behalf代 for 300三百 coins. In early Meiji, before lawyer was an official profession, people who spoke on your behalf in legal matters where 代言人. The '300 coins' implies a cheap price, and that such an advocate was little more than a paid liar.
row.jpn: 詭弁を弄すること。

row.notes: Ethos精神 of the prose散文. Focus away from romanticism and towards realism advocated by novelist Takeda Rintaro (武田麟太郎).
row.jpn: 小説執筆上の精神のありかた。

row.notes: Three三 positions位, one一 body体. Note that 位 is read み！
row.jpn: 別々の三つのものが一つのように緊密に結びつくこと。また、三者が心をあわせること。

row.notes: Mountains山 and water水. 容態 is the shape or state of something.
row.jpn: 山の形と水のようす。

row.notes: 在在 is existing everywhere. 所所 is various places.
row.jpn: あちらこちら。また、いたるところ。

row.notes: 残念・無念 both mean regrettable or lamentable
row.jpn: 非常にくやしいこと。

row.notes: Remains残 of a volume編, fragmented断 bamboo簡 writings
row.jpn: 書物の切れ端。

row.notes: 思案 is thinking over and over. 投首 is hanging your head down.
row.jpn: あれこれ考えあぐんで困っているさま。

row.notes: Four四 sufferings苦, eight八 sufferings苦. From Buddhist teachings: 四苦 includes life, old age, sickness and death. 八苦 includes separation from loved ones, seeing someone you hate, avarice, physical/mental pain
row.jpn: さんざん苦労すること。非常な苦しみ。

row.english: Doing what you believe is right, no matter what other's say
row.notes: Confucius子 has an audience見 with Nanzi (南子). Disciple Zilu (子路) thought it improper for Confucius to accept an invitation from Duke Ling of Wei (霊公) to have an audience with his wife Nanzi, but Confucius said, "If I have done wrong, may the heavens reject me!"
row.jpn: 礼の道を守るため、回りの意見にまどわされず、自分の考えを通すこと。

row.english: The height of fairness; Exceedingly fair
row.notes: 公平 is fariness and equality. 至 is the height or epitome.
row.jpn: きわめて公平である。

row.english: A scholar and a virtuous person
row.notes: A man士 who strives志 for learning and a person人 of virtue仁
row.jpn: 学問修養に志す人と仁徳のある人。

row.english: Receiving master's teachings; Receiving special knowledge or technical expertise
row.notes: Master's師 asset資 by the partner相 accepted承
row.jpn: 師の教えを受け継ぐこと。また、師から弟子へ学問・技術などを受け継いでいくこと。

row.notes: Children子 and grandchildren孫
row.jpn: 末代まで。

row.english: An impractical idea or plan; Good on paper, not in practice
row.notes: Discussion談 of military兵 strategy on上 paper紙
row.jpn: 理屈だけで、実際にはまったく役に立たないこと。

row.english: A geographically perfect area of land
row.notes: Suitable相応 for the Four四 Gods神. Each of the Four Gods represents an aspect of land. Seiryu (青龍) of the East represents abundant flowing water. Byakko (白虎) of the West represents large accomodating roads. Suzaku (朱雀) to the South represents low basins for buildings and fields. Genbu (玄武) to the North represents hills and mountains. Used to describe the old capital in Kyoto.
row.jpn: 四神に応じた最もよいとされる地相のこと。

row.english: Life and death is for the heavens to decide
row.notes: Death死 and life生 have有 their orders命 from heaven
row.jpn: 人の生き死には天命であり、人の力ではどうすることもできない。

row.notes: Nothing but 3三 inches寸 from the tongue舌 tip先, i.e., includes no heart or sincerity
row.jpn: 口先だけで誠実さがない

row.kun: 七(なな)転(ころ)び八(や)起(お)き
row.english: If at first you don't succeed, try, try again
row.notes: Fall転 seven七 times, stand起 up eight八. Often read ななころびやおき even without okurigana.
row.jpn: 失敗を重ねても、くじけることなく奮起すること。

row.english: All manner of calamity and suffering
row.notes: In the Guanyin Yishu (観音経), the seven七 calamities難 are: fire (火難), flood (水難), Rakshasa (羅刹難), tyranny (王難), evil spirits (鬼難), imprisonment (枷鎖難) and bandits (怨賊難). The eight八 sufferings苦 are: birth (生苦), old age (老苦), illness (病苦), death (死苦), separation from loved ones (愛別離苦), being confronted with hated things (怨憎会苦), unfulfilled desires (求不得苦) and the Five Aggregates (五陰盛苦).
row.jpn: ありとあらゆる災難・苦難のこと。

row.notes: In中 certain death死 situation, seeking求 life活
row.jpn: 死ぬ覚悟で難関を切り抜ける。

row.notes: A seven七 ri里 barrier結界. 里 is a unit of distance used often in sayings, similar to 'mile' in English. Originally, a literal barrier to repel demons in Esoteric Buddhism.
row.jpn: ある人を嫌って寄せつけないこと。

row.notes: Four四 roads通 reaching達 eight八 different places
row.jpn: 道路が四方八方に広がっているさま。

row.notes: Question質疑 and answer応答
row.jpn: 疑わしい点を聞いただしたり、それに答えたりする。

row.notes: Samurai士, farmers農, craftsmen工 and merchants商.
row.jpn: 武士・農民・工人・商人の職分による自分階級。

row.english: All manner of illness and afflictions
row.notes: 404四百四 illnesses病. Each of the four elements, earth, water, fire and wind are responsible for 101 different illnesses.
row.jpn: 人のかかるあらゆる病気。

row.notes: Four四 outside the gate門 excursions出遊. The trips young Buddha took outside the palace where he saw the suffering of the people and was inspired to seek enlightenment.
row.jpn: 釈迦がまだ太子であったとき、王城の四方の門から郊外に出かけ、老・病・死の苦を見て人生の無常を感じ、出家を決意したということ。

row.notes: Four四 outside the gate門 excursions遊観. The trips young Buddha took outside the palace where he saw the suffering of the people and was inspired to seek enlightenment.
row.jpn: 釈迦がまだ太子であったとき、王城の四方の門から郊外に出かけ、老・病・死の苦を見て人生の無常を感じ、出家を決意したということ。

row.kun: 近(ちか)きを舎(す)てて遠(とお)きを求(もと)む
row.english: Seeking happiness far away and not realizing it is already close by
row.notes: [Throwing away>舎(捨) what is close近 to seek求 what is far遠
row.jpn: 身近に良いものがあることがわからず、遠くまでさがし求めること。

row.english: To best solve a problem, think outside the box
row.notes: If you want to shoot射 the general将, first先 shoot the horse馬. Take out what the enemy relies on to ensure their defeat.
row.jpn: 目的を達成するためには、まず相手がよりどころとしているものを攻めるのがよいということ。

row.english: ① Quit bad habits and acquire positive ones ② Get rid of useless things and promote good things
row.notes: Dispose舎(捨) of demerits短所 and take取 on merits長所
row.jpn: 短所や欠点をすてて、長所をのばすこと。また、つまらないものを排除して、よいものを取りあげること。

row.notes: Many衆 discuss議 and come to one一 decision決
row.jpn: 多くの人の議論・相談の結果、意見が一致し結論が出ること。

row.notes: An autumn秋 of high高 skies (clear of low hanging clouds) and fat肥 horses馬 (well fed on autumn harvest)
row.jpn: 空高く澄み渡ったさわやかな秋の季節をいう。

row.english: Master oneself to serve as an example to others
row.notes: Train修 yourself己 and become virtuous to then rule治 over people人
row.jpn: 自分に徳を積んで世を治めること。

row.notes: 縮 and 節 mean to reduce or use sparingly. 衣 is clothing and 食 food.
row.jpn: 節約・倹約すること。

row.notes: Earth地 represents the current state of government, and heaven天 the ideal. 縮 is to shrink down and remove the bad, and 補 is to supplement the good.
row.jpn: 政治上の改革を行うこと。

row.notes: Varities種種 of things, mixed雑 and numerous多
row.jpn: いろいろなものが入り混じっていること。

row.notes: A lake池 of liquor酒 and forest林 of meat肉
row.jpn: ぜいたくの限りを尽くした豪奢な宴会。

row.notes: 諸行=all things; 無常=not constant
row.jpn: 人生ははかないものであるという仏教の根本思想。

row.english: Pretending to know something you don't; Bullshitting
row.notes: From a story where a tourist lies about going to Kyoto for sightseeing. Someone asks 'How was 白河?' (a region in Kyoto). The tourist hears this as 白川 and thinks it's the name of a river, so the tourist says, 'I don't know, I slept all night夜 on the boat船.' and this exposes their lie.
row.jpn: 知ったかぶりをいう。また、何も知らないほど、ぐっすり寝こんでしまうこと。

row.notes: Four四 times six六 makes 24 hours時
row.jpn: 一日じゅう。いつも。

row.notes: 心機=feelings; 一転=a reversal
row.jpn: なにかをきっかけとして、気持ちがすっかり変わること。

row.english: Making a mountain out of a molehill
row.notes: Make a small小 pin針 into a large大 pole棒
row.jpn: 物事を実際より大げさにいう。

row.english: Patting yourself on the back; Tooting your own horn
row.notes: Self自 praise賛 of your own自 work画
row.jpn: 自分のことを自分でほめること。

row.notes: Own自 income給, own自 means足
row.jpn: 必要な物を自分でまかない十分に足りるようにすること。

row.notes: Self自己 suggestion暗示 to help relax or draw out ability
row.jpn: 自分で自分に暗示をかけること。

row.english: Moment by moment, minute by minute
row.notes: 時刻 is a moment or specific point in time
row.jpn: 時を追ってつぎつぎと。

row.notes: No無 roots根 in reality事実
row.jpn: 事実に基づいていないこと。

row.english: Each and every matter or thing
row.notes: Matters事 and things物, repeated for emphasis
row.jpn: あらゆる物事。

row.english: Barely escaping with your life; Pulling your ass out of the fire
row.notes: Ten十 ways to die死, but you find the one一 way to live生
row.jpn: ほとんど助かる見込みのないところをかろうじて命拾いすること。

row.notes: [Out of>中 ten十 (100%), around eight八 (80%) or nine九 (90%)
row.jpn: ほとんど。

row.reading: じゃくにくきょうしょく
row.notes: Meat肉 of the weak弱 becomes food食 for the strong強
row.jpn: 弱い者が強い者の犠牲にされること。

row.notes: From Confucian Analects: "At 15, I aspired志 to learn学"
row.jpn: 十五歳で学問の道にこころざす。

row.notes: Ten十 represents 100%, everything. 全 is perfection and 美 is beautifully arranged.
row.jpn: すべてが完全で整っていること。

row.notes: Ten十 people人, ten十 types色
row.jpn: 人の好みや考え方、性格などはそれぞれ違うということ。

row.english: The more things change, the more they stay the same
row.notes: Ten十 years年 pass, but it feels like yesterday (one一 day日 ago)
row.jpn: 長年経っても変わらないこと。

row.reading: じゅうねんひとむかし
row.notes: Ten十 years年 ago feels like [long ago>一昔
row.jpn: 世の中の移りかわりが激しいことのたとえ。

row.english: ① Good farming weather ② Peaceful times
row.notes: Ten十 windy風 days, good for spreading seeds/pollen; and five五 rainy雨 days, good for the soil
row.jpn: 世の中が平穏であるたとえ。

row.notes: Ten十, 10,000万 and 100,000,000億 represent the greatness of the journey it takes to reach this land土
row.jpn: 極楽浄土のこと。

row.english: On a pilgrimage to become a monk
row.notes: Sleeping under下 trees樹 and on上 rocks石
row.jpn: 出家行脚の境遇のこと。

row.english: Acting freely, doing as you please
row.notes: 自由 is freedom. 自在 is existing as you wish.
row.jpn: 何事も思いのままにすること。

row.notes: War戦 tactics術 that consist of sending a sea海 of people人
row.jpn: 多数の人員を投じて仕事を完成させること。

row.english: A cool mouth and warm feet live long
row.notes: Keep the head頭 cool寒 and the feet足 warm熱, written by poet George Herbert
row.jpn: 頭を冷やし足をあたためること。

row.notes: Farm耕 when it's clear晴, read読 when it rains雨
row.jpn: 田園で悠々自適の生活をすること。

row.english: Being born with innate knowledge of the Way
row.notes: Born生 knowing知 and easily安 going行 along the Way. One of the three ways of discovering the Way according to the Doctrine of the Mean. One is to be born with innate knowledge of the Way (生知安行). One is to learn学 of it, know知 it, recognize its benefit利 and practice行 it. The third is to realize the Way only after great suffering and effort (困知勉行).
row.jpn: 生まれながらにして人のふみ行うべき道を熟知し、心安んじてそれを行うこと。

row.english: ① Clear weather ② A clear conscience ③ Completely innocent
row.notes: Blue青 sky天, white白 sun日
row.jpn: 心にやましいことがまったくないことのたとえ。

row.notes: The same同 wind風 blows for 1,000千 miles里 in all directions; Also 万里同風
row.jpn: 世の中が平和であること。

row.notes: End絶 of body体, end絶 of life命 situation
row.jpn: せっぱつまってどうにも逃げられない状態。

row.english: Omniscience and omnipotence; All-knowing and all-powerful
row.notes: All全 knowledge知, all全 abilities能
row.jpn: 神の能力

row.english: The three harmful types of friendship
row.notes: The 3三 kinds者 of harmful損 friends友: those who are deceptive, those of poor character, and those who are insincere. From the Analects of Confucius.
row.jpn: 交わって損をする三種類の友人。

row.english: Great talent matures late; A late bloomer
row.notes: A large大 container器 takes long into the night晩 to complete成
row.jpn: 大人物は往々にして、遅れて頭角をあらわすことのたとえ。

row.notes: Many多 issues事, many多 difficulties難
row.jpn: 条件が多く、困難なことが多いこと。

row.reading: たんとうちょくにゅう
row.notes: Get directly直 into入 the heart of the matter with one単 swing of the blade刀
row.jpn: 前置きなしに、いきなり本願に入ること。

row.english: Largely the same; Essentially the same
row.notes: Largely大 the same同 with only small小 differences異
row.jpn: 細かい点に違いはあるが、だいたいは同じであること。

row.notes: Gods神明 of heaven天 and Earth地
row.jpn: 天と地のすべての神々のこと。

row.notes: 天地=heaven and earth, top and bottom of package; 無用=do not misuse
row.jpn: 荷物の上下を逆さまにしてはいけない。

row.notes: 天変=disaster from the sky…heavy rain, meteors, etc.; 地異=disaster of the earth…earthquakes, volcanoes, etc.
row.jpn: 地震・暴風など天地間に起こる自然の異変。

row.notes: Fast as lightning電光 or 石火sparks
row.jpn: 動作や振る舞いが非常にすばやいこと。

row.notes: Determine断 alone独 and act行 alone専
row.jpn: 自分一人の判断で勝手に物事を行うこと。

row.notes: A pair二束 of sandals for three三 bits文
row.jpn: 極端に安い値で品物を売ること。

row.kun: 白(しろ)い馬(うま)は馬(うま)に非(あら)ず
row.english: A strained or misleading interpretation; Sophistry
row.notes: The white白 horse馬 is not非 a horse馬. A paradox posed by logician Gongsun Long (公孫竜). A white horse requires two attributes, being white and being a horse. Conversely, a horse can be brown, reddish, black, etc. Therefore, a 'white horse' is not a 'horse,' strictly speaking.
row.jpn: こじつけや詭弁をいう。

row.notes: Half半 believe信, half半 doubt疑
row.jpn: 本当かどうか判断に迷うこと。

row.english: A don't; A example of what not to do
row.notes: Opposite反 side面 teaching教師
row.jpn: まねてはならないが逆に反省の糧となるような人・事物をいう。

row.english: Let a hundred schools of thought contend
row.notes: Let a hundred百 schools家 of thought shout鳴 and contend争
row.jpn: さまざまな立場の人が自由に議論をすること。

row.reading: ひゃっぱつひゃくちゅう
row.notes: 100百 shots発, 100百 bullseyes中
row.jpn: (NULL)

row.english: Swift as the wind, silent as the forest, relentless as fire, and unyielding as a mountain.
row.notes: Swift as the wind風, silent as the forest林, relentless as fire火, and unyielding as a mountain山
row.jpn: 物事の時機や情勢に応じた行動のしかたのこと。

row.notes: Without不 undoing解 your clothes衣 sash帯 to change
row.jpn: あることに不眠不休で専念すること。

row.notes: Act実行 without不 words言
row.jpn: あれこれ理屈をいわずに黙って実際に行動すること。

row.notes: No不 aging老 no不 death死
row.jpn: 永久に老いることなく生きること。

row.notes: Eternal長久 fortune運 as a warrior武
row.jpn: 戦いの場での幸運が長く続くこと。

row.notes: A person who masters both両 paths道, cultural文 and military武
row.jpn: 学問と武芸。また、その両方にすぐれていること。

row.notes: Opening開化 to the influence of other civilizations文明
row.jpn: 人知が開け世の中が進歩して、文化の水準が高くなること。

row.notes: Laying your body身 flat平 and lowering低 your head頭
row.jpn: ひたすら恐縮しへりくだること。また、ひたすらあやまること。

row.notes: World天下 domination that lasts three三 days日
row.jpn: 権力の座にあることがきわめて短期間であること。

row.english: Your only talent is for eating
row.notes: No無 skill芸, big大 eater食
row.jpn: これといった特技や才能もなく、ただ人並み以上に食べるだけのこと。

row.notes: The kanji were chosen become their readings match the pronunciation of the word; Also 滅茶苦茶(めちゃくちゃ) or 目茶目茶(めちゃめちゃ)
row.jpn: 筋道が立たないこと。

row.notes: Devoid無 of illness病, cessation息 of woe災
row.jpn: 病気をしないで健康であること。

row.notes: Clear明 as a polished mirror鏡, still止 as water水
row.jpn: 邪念がなくすっきりと澄みきった心境。

row.notes: To acquiesce従 on the suface面, but revolt背 in your stomach腹 (inner feelings)
row.jpn: 表面だけ服従するふりをして内心は反抗していること。

row.notes: Secret knowledge or tech that doesn't不 come出 outside外 the [inner circle>門
row.jpn: 秘蔵して、人に見せたり持ち出したりしないこと。

row.notes: Famous有名, but you've produced実 nothing無
row.jpn: 名なかり立派で実質がそれに伴わないこと。

row.notes: Carelessness油断 (caused by a false sense of security) is a great大 enemy敵
row.jpn: 注意を怠れば必ず失敗を招くから警戒せよいという戒め。

row.english: Adapting to the situation; Playing it by ear
row.notes: 機に臨み変に応ず。 View臨 the situation機 and respond応 with change変
row.jpn: 状況や事態の変化に応じて適切な処置をすること。

row.english: No one knows when their time will come
row.notes: Old老 or young少, everyone's time to die in undetermined不定
row.jpn: 人間の寿命は年齢に関係なく予知できないものだということ。
